remarks: An ultrafilter is either fixed or free.  A fixed ultrafilter is called principal (generated by a single element ` A ` ), and a free ultrafilter is called nonprincipal (having empty intersection).  Note that examples of free ultrafilters cannot be defined in ZFC without some form of global choice.  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 4-Dec-2009.)  (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Aug-2015.)
statement:
uffixfr $p |- ( F e. ( UFil ` X ) -> ( A e. |^| F <-> F = { x e. ~P X | A e. x } ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d F x $.
$d X x $.
